headline: Trump Endorses J.D. Vance  Who Once Called Him an Idiot, Noxious, and Reprehensible  for Senate in Ohio
author: Ryan Bort
sentences:
Vance for Senate in Ohio, calling him the most qualified candidate? who is ready to win.?
This is not an easy endorsement for me to make because like and respect some of the other candidates in the race  theyve said great things about Trump,? the former president wrote, adding that Vance has both brains and braun.?
NEW!

I look forward to earning his endorsement in the general election and working with him to defeat Tim Ryan in November.?
Trumps decision on Friday to throw his weight behind Vance is not surprising given that Vance has been pushing Trumpism for months, most notably in taking a hard line on immigration.

Vance pic.twitter.com/KVLpipj1bg
 Liz Harrington (@realLizUSA) April 15, 2022
Ohios Republican primary for Senate has been a clown car, even by the GOPs standards, and Vance and Josh Mandel, in particular, have been jockeying for control of the wheel for months.

But he cannot fix what ails them, and one day theyll realize it.? CNN reported earlier on Friday that Vance also on multiple occasion cited racism as the reason Trump was able to garner so much support ahead of the 2016 election.

All of us say stupid things,? he explained during a debate last month, and I happen to say stupid things very publicly.? He also touted Trump as the greatest president of my lifetime.?
It looks like that work has paid off.
Vance may have said some not so great things about me in the past, but he gets it now, and I have seen that in spades,? Trump wrote in endorsing him on Friday.
He called him an idiot.? He called him noxious.? He called him reprehensible.? He wrote a piece for The Atlantic comparing Trumpism to opioid addiction.
Vance has done yeomans work trying to walk back his comments now that hes running for office as a Republican in Ohio.
The endorsement is surprising, however, in that Vance was one of Trumps fiercest critics ahead of the 2016 election.
I continue to be a proud supporter of President Trump and the America First agenda,? Mandel responded on Twitter.
A Fox News poll released last month placed him in third, with his support coming in at just 11 percent.
NBC News also reported on Thursday that the former president was gearing up to endorse him.
Trumps endorsement will surely buoy Vances candidacy, but he still has some work to do.
Mike Gibbons (22 percent) and Josh Mandel (20 percent) were ahead of him.
President Donald J. Trump announces his endorsement of J.D.
Ohios Republican primary for Senate takes place on May 3.
Donald Trump has officially endorsed J.D.
